item.title: Do you need a local master branch?
item.description:
I noticed recently that I’ve (almost) never used a local master branch in Git. I only use it in simple one-off playground repos that I don’t plan to support and never in professional development or in “serious” pet-projects.

So, is it really required?

item.title: Cleaning Git repos
item.description: I guess, all popular Git repositories allow you to delete source branch when the PR with this branch is accepted. But sometimes you forget to use this option and end up with hundreds or thousands of stale branches across dozens of projects.
